summary: The document is a confidential CIA information telegram from October 4, 1963, detailing Dieu Hue's planned suicide to support the Buddhist cause, aiming to influence the United Nations. She prepared a letter denouncing her son, Buu Hoi, and alleging ongoing persecution of Buddhism in Vietnam, intended for the foreign press and clandestine opposition. Her companion planned to seek asylum at the U.S. Embassy, fearing for her life post-suicide. This document is part of the National Security Files related to Vietnam, reviewed under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: Planned suicide of Dieu Hue to support the Buddhist cause.
Preparation of a letter denouncing her son and claiming persecution of Buddhism in Vietnam.
Intention to distribute the letter to the foreign press and clandestine opposition.
Companion's plan to seek asylum at the U.S. Embassy fearing for her life.
The suicide was timed to impact the United Nations.
